text.para: With PHP, there are two basic ways to get output: echo and print. In this tutorial we use echo or print in almost every example. So, this chapter contains a little more info about those two output statements.

list.item: A variable starts with the $ sign, followed by the name of the variable
A variable name must start with a letter or the underscore character
A variable name cannot start with a number
A variable name can only contain alpha-numeric characters and underscores (A-z, 0-9, and _ )
Variable names are case-sensitive ($age and $AGE are two different variables)

text.para: The PHP echo statement is often used to output data to the screen.The following example will show how to output text and a variable:

editor.title: Example
editor.syntax:
<?php
$txt = "W3Schools.com";
echo "I love $txt!";
echo "\n";
echo "I love " . $txt . "!";
echo "\n";
$x = 5;
$y = 4;
echo $x + $y;
?>
